name: Age
text: How old are you?
choices: 20 or younger, 21-40, 41-60, 61 or over, I'd rather not say
useHelp: Connecting which stories are told by people of what ages can be a useful way to look at stories.

name: Gender
text: What is your gender?
choices: male, female, I'd rather not say
help: Enter any sort of location you like, specific or vague.
useHelp: This question is most useful when your community is geographic.

name: How feel about community
text: How do you feel about this community?
choices: it's great!, it's okay, I don't understand it, I don't have time for it, pretty silly if you ask me, I don't like it, I'd rather not say
help: Describe how you feel about this place.
useHelp: Connecting which stories are told by people of what ages can be a useful way to look at stories.

name: Why joined
text: Why did you join this community?
choices: somebody asked me to, I wanted to, I started it, I heard about it, I'd rather not say

name: How feel about
text: How do you feel about this story?
choices: great, good, okay, not so great, bad, awful, I'd rather not say
help: What was your reaction when you read the story?
useHelp: This is a very useful question and should almost always be included.

name: When happened
text: When did this story happen?
choices: today, within the past month, within a few months, within the last year, within the last two years, within the last five years, I'm not sure, I'd rather not say

name: Intensity
text: How emotionally intense would you say this story is?
choices: extremely, very, moderately, not much, not at all, I'd rather not say

name: Reason
text: Why do you think this story was told?
choices: to inform, to persuade, to attack, to defend, to entertain, to educate, to reminisce, to help, I'd rather not say

name: Observations
text: What pattern do you see?
help: Please describe what is noteworthy, confining yourself to facts that anyone could agree on.

name: Interpretations
text: What do you think this pattern means?
help: Venture an opinion on why the pattern appears the way it does.

name: Implications
text: What do you think should be done about this pattern?
help: If this pattern represents a problem, what can be done about it? If it represents and opportunity, what can be done to benefit from it?

name: Why built
text: Why was this collage built?t
help: Give viewers some idea of the collage's purpose.

name: Useful to whom
text: To whom do you think this collage will be useful?
help: Which of these types of collage best describes this one?

name: Why asked
text: Why was this invitation created?
help: Please describe why you think this invitation's creator (yourself or someone else) asked people talk about this.

name: Reference
text: Is this invitation in reference to an event, person, thing, what?
help: Is there anything this invitation asks about in particular?

name: Why added
text: Why was this resource added to the community? What is its value?
help: Give your opinion about the reasons behind this resource being added.

name: Source
text: Where did this resource come from?

name: to use the same questions
text: for members and characters (even if you add more for characters)
choices: then people can search on both.
